page.description: Get the value of a column in a List control.

argument.name: UXListName
argument.description: The List control containing the control.

argument.name: UXControlName
argument.description: The column in the List control to read the value from.

argument.name: rowNumber
argument.description: Optional. A zero based row number. The row in the List control to read the value from.

page.discussion: Unlike the .getValue() method, which returns the value for the currently selected row, you can pass an optional *[js:rowNumber]* to get the data in a exlpicit row.
page.example: //Read value in 'LASTNAME' field from the 3rd row of 'LIST1'. var lname = {dialog.object}.listGetValue('LIST1','LASTNAME',2);
